pull.title: Update ban-state in case of dirty-state during periodic sweep
pull.body:
We do currently not update the UI during periodic ban list sweeps (via dump banlist).
Fixes #11612

events.body:
Great! Just a nit: According to the [Developer Notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md)

> If an `if` only has a single-statement `then`-clause, it can appear
    on the same line as the `if`, without braces. In every other case,
    braces are required, and the `then` and `else` clauses must appear
    correctly indented on a new line.

shouldn't it be written like

```
if(clientInterface) clientInterface->BannedListChanged();
```
or
```
if(clientInterface) {
    clientInterface->BannedListChanged();
}
```
?

verification.payload:
tree 2dba565e3e3cbb1ceec8d0a76e25d655e9127d60
parent 8335cb478183d800e274f6e96f9d7269ae584220

Update ban-state in case of dirty-state during periodic sweep

events.message: Update ban-state in case of dirty-state during periodic sweep

events.body: looks good after scoping to avoid holding the lock during the callback.

Thanks @theuni for the review.
lock-de-scoped the signal call part, switched `setBannedIsDirty` to an atomic.
Best reviewed with ?w=1

@jonasschnelli making setBannedIsDirty atomic doesn't work, i'm afraid, as setBanned/setBannedIsDirty must remain in sync. See CConnman::Unban for an example of where an atomic setBannedIsDirty could go out of sync with setBanned if it's unset elsewhere without cs_setBanned.

verification.payload:

parent c8538123a7618343056b8ca2bc7445de8f0620ec
author Jonas Schnelli <dev@jonasschnelli.ch> 1511077107 -1000

Call BannedListChanged outside of cs_setBanned lock

events.message: Call BannedListChanged outside of cs_setBanned lock

events.body: @theuni. Thanks. Your right. Just change the approach.

comments.body: I think an appropriate place for this would be in `SweepBanned()` itself (at the end, if anything changed), as the list is changed there. It just happens to be called from here, but there are other places.
This needs to be called without cs_setBanned.
